meanings.definition: The quality or state of being immovable.
meanings.sent1: Her immovableness in the face of danger impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The mountain's immovableness made it a symbol of strength.
meanings.sent3: The immovableness of the sleeping cat was comical as it snored loudly.
meanings.sent4: His immovableness in his beliefs was like a rock in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The immovableness of the ancient statue captured the essence of time standing still.

meanings.definition: The inability to be moved or changed.
meanings.sent1: The immovableness of the boulder blocked the path completely.
meanings.sent2: Despite her efforts, the immovableness of the stubborn door frustrated her.
meanings.sent3: The immovableness of the toddler's refusal to eat vegetables was both amusing and concerning.
meanings.sent4: The immovableness of the traffic jam seemed to defy all logic.
meanings.sent5: His immovableness in his decision to quit his job shocked his colleagues.
